obj0: Conceptual overview of law and methods in engineering subjects
obj1:
To understand the major theoretical background of functions, limits, derivatives and their application in
engineering problems
source0: Textbook: "Calculus a Complete Course", Robert A. Adams, Pearson 6th Edn 2006
source1: "Calculus Early Transcendental Functions", Robert T.Smith & Roland B. Minton 4th Edition,2012
source2: "Calculus Early Transcendental" Briggs Cochran, William Briggs, Lyle Cochran, Bernard Gillett
out0: Analyze functions and functions of graphs
out1: Understand concept of limit and continuity
out4: Understand concept of drawing graph of derivatives and limits
contrib0: Ability to understand and apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering
contrib1: Ability to design and conduct experiments as well as to analyze and interpret
contrib2:
Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams while exhibiting professional responsibility and
ethical conduct
contrib3: Ability to apply systems thinking in problem solving
contrib4: Knowledge of contemporary issues while continuing to engage in lifelong learning
contrib5:
Ability to use the techniques, skills and modern engineering tools necessary for engineering
practice
contrib6: Ability to express their ideas and findings, in written and oral form
contrib7:
Ability to design and integrate systems, components or processes to meet desired needs within
realistic constraints
contrib8:
Ability to approach engineering problems and effects of their possible solutions within a well
structured, ethically responsible and professional manner
ectsact1: Course duration in class (including the Exam week)
consub6: Differentiation rules ,The chain rule, The derivative Of Trigonemetric Functions
